fields_of_interest: Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Budget, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Public Health, Digital economy and society, Transport, Borders and Security
eu_initiatives: The organisation follows developments related to the following topics: eCall, telecommunications, caller location in case of emergencies, European emergency number 112, the Universal Service Directive, the European Electronic Communications Code, emergency services communications, public safety.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
EENA, the European Emergency Number Association, is a Brussels-based NGO set up in 1999 dedicated to promoting high-quality emergency services reached by the number 112 throughout the EU. EENA's mission is to contribute to improving the functioning of emergency services for citizens. EENA serves as a discussion platform for emergency services, public authorities, decision makers, associations and solution providers in view of improving emergency response in accordance with citizens' requirements. EENA is also promoting the establishment of an efficient system for alerting citizens about imminent or developing emergencies.  
The EENA memberships include more than 1300 emergency services representatives from over 80 countries world-wide, 90 solution providers, 15 international associations/organisations, more than 200 Members of the European Parliament and 90 researchers.
relevant_communication:
Communication activities of the organisation include the following. 
EU Projects, such as: CHORIST (2006-2009), epSOS (2008-2013), REACH112 (2009-2012), HeERO (2011-2014), ESENet (2013-2014), EmerGent (2014-2017), HELP 112 (2016-2017). 
 
Other events: EENA Annual Conference; EENA Members Workshop (2017: Members Workshop and Meet your MEP event), 112 & the European Electronic Communications Code (in 2017 on the occasion of 112 Day), #Attacks: Social Media & Public Warning (special workshop/event in 2016) and more. For all past events of EENA, please check here: http://www.eena.org/past-events 
 
Publications: EENA Annual Publication "Public Safety Answering Points - Global edition" (launch in 2016), Annual Publication "Public Safety Answering Points in Europe" (until 2016), semester publication “The “who-is-who” handbook in the public safety industry” (launch in 2016). 
 
Also, EENA Committees produce a series of operational and technical documents, available here: http://www.eena.org/pages/operations-documents and here: http://www.eena.org/pages/technical-documents
